abstract: University of Iowa study published in journal Current Biology reports that researchers were able to record brain activity of patient with tinnitus, and succeeded in temporarily suppressing condition by subjecting patient to white noise.
lead_paragraph: A patient allowed researchers to record his brain activity while he experienced a ringing in his ears, and they were able to suppress it.

headline.main: The Brain of a Tinnitus Sufferer
headline.print_headline: Biology: How Tinnitus Affects a Sufferer’s Brain

snippet: A patient allowed researchers to record his brain activity while he experienced a ringing in his ears, and they were able to suppress it.
